Module.name: Balance
Module.long_help: Balance data among available processes.
Module.short_help: Load balance filter.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Balance the number of cells on all processes.

Module.name: AllToN
Module.long_help: Redistribute data to a subset of available processes.
Module.short_help: Repartition data filter.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Redistribute polydata to a subset of processes.

Module.name: AppendAttributes
Module.long_help: Copies geometry from first input. Puts all of the arrays into the output.
Module.short_help: Puts all input arrays into the single output.

Module.name: AppendPolyData
Module.long_help: Takes an input of multiple poly data parts and output has only one part.
Module.short_help: Append multiple parts into one.

Module.name: CellCenters
Module.long_help: Create a point (no geometry) at the center of each input cell.
Module.short_help: Convert cells to vertices.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

LabeledToggle.label: Generate vertices
LabeledToggle.help: Generate vertex as geometry of just points.

Module.name: CellDataToPointData
Module.long_help: Create point attributes by averaging cell attributes.
Module.short_help: Convert cell data to point data.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

LabeledToggle.label: Pass cell data
LabeledToggle.help: Control whether the input cell data is to be passed to the output. If on, then the input cell data is passed through to the output; otherwise, only generated point data is placed into the output.

Module.name: CleanPolyData
Module.long_help: Merge coincident points if they do not meet a feature edge critera.
Module.short_help: Merge coincident points.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

LabeledToggle.label: Piece invariant
LabeledToggle.help: Turn this on to remove seams when running in parallel.

VectorEntry.help: The tolerance in terms of fraction of bounding box length.

VectorEntry.label: Absolute tolerance
VectorEntry.help: The tolerance in absolute terms.

LabeledToggle.label: Tolerance is absolute
LabeledToggle.help: Turn this on to use the absolute tolerance.

LabeledToggle.label: Convert lines to points
LabeledToggle.help: Turn on/off conversion of degenerate lines to points.

LabeledToggle.label: Convert polys to lines
LabeledToggle.help: Turn on/off conversion of degenerate polys to lines.

LabeledToggle.label: Convert strips to polys
LabeledToggle.help: Turn on/off conversion of degenerate strips to polys.

LabeledToggle.label: Point merging
LabeledToggle.help: Turn this On to control wheter points merging is performed.

Module.name: PVConnectivityFilter
Module.long_help: Mark connected components with integer point attribute array.
Module.short_help: Find connected components.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

Module.name: ImageClip
Module.long_help: Efficiently extract an area/volume of interest from a 2-d image or 3-d volume.
Module.short_help: Extract a volume of interest.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

ExtentEntry.label: Extent to crop
ExtentEntry.help: Set the min/max extents in each dimension of the output

Module.name: Curvatures
Module.long_help: This filter will compute the gaussian or mean curvature of the mesh at each point.
Module.short_help: Compute the curvature at each point.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

LabeledToggle.label: Invert mean curvature
LabeledToggle.help: Turn this on to invert the mean curvature calculation for meshes with inward pointing normals.

Module.name: DecimatePro
Module.long_help: Simplify a polygonal model using an adaptive edge collapse algorithm. This filter works with triangles only.
Module.short_help: Reduce the number of triangles in a model.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

VectorEntry.label: Reduction target
VectorEntry.help: Value between 0 and 1. Desired reduction of the total number of triangles.

LabeledToggle.label: Preserve topology
LabeledToggle.help: If off, better reduction can occur, but model may break up.

VectorEntry.label: Feature angle
VectorEntry.help: This angle is used to define a feature edge. (i.e., if the surface normal between two adjacent triangles is >= Feature angle, an edge exists). Topology can be split along feature edges.

LabeledToggle.label: Boundary deletable
LabeledToggle.help: If off, decimate will not remove points on the boundary.

Module.name: D3
Module.long_help: Repartition a data set.
Module.short_help: Repartition a data set.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

ArrayMenu.label: Scalars
ArrayMenu.help: Select the input scalars to process.

VectorEntry.label: Kernel Size
VectorEntry.help: Determines the dilation neighborhood.

Module.name: ElevationFilter
Module.long_help: Create point attribute array by projecting points onto an elevation vector.
Module.short_help: Create a point array representing elevation.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

VectorEntry.label: Scalar range
VectorEntry.help: Set the range of scalar values to generate

LineWidget.help: Set the minimum and maximum point for elevation

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

ArrayMenu.label: Scalars
ArrayMenu.help: Select the input scalars to process.

VectorEntry.label: Kernel Size
VectorEntry.help: Determines the erosion neighborhood.

Module.name: CTHPart
Module.long_help: Create a surface from a CTH volume fraction.
Module.short_help: Extract a part from a CTH dataset.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

SelectCTHArrays.help: Select the volume fraction arrays for generating parts.

ImplicitPlaneWidget.help: Adjusts the parameters of the plane to clip with.

Module.name: ExtractEdges
Module.long_help: Extract edges of 2-d and 3-d cells as lines.
Module.short_help: Covert data to wireframe.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

Module.name: ExtractGrid
Module.long_help: Extract a subgrid from a curvilinear grid with the option of setting subsample strides.
Module.short_help: Extract a subgrid or subsample.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

ExtentEntry.help: Set the min/max values of the volume of interest (VOI). The output will have the (I,J,K) extent specified here.

VectorEntry.label: Sample rate
VectorEntry.help: Set the sampling rate for each dimension

LabeledToggle.label: Include boundary
LabeledToggle.help: Select whether to always include the boundary of the grid in the output

Module.name: ExtractParts
Module.long_help: Extract a subset of parts from a group.
Module.short_help: Extract a subset of parts from a group.

Module.name: ExtractVOI
Module.long_help: Extract a subgrid from a volume/image with the option of setting subsample strides.
Module.short_help: Extract a subvolume or subsample.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

ExtentEntry.help: Set the min/max values of the volume of interest (VOI). The output will have the (I,J,K) extent specified here.

VectorEntry.label: Sample rate
VectorEntry.help: Set the sampling rate for each dimension

Module.name: ExtractRectilinearGrid
Module.long_help: Extract a subgrid from a rectilinear grid with the option of setting subsample strides.
Module.short_help: Extract a subgrid or subsample.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

ExtentEntry.help: Set the min/max values of the volume of interest (VOI). The output will have the (I,J,K) extent specified here.

VectorEntry.label: Sample rate
VectorEntry.help: Set the sampling rate for each dimension

LabeledToggle.label: Include boundary
LabeledToggle.help: Select whether to always include the boundary of the grid in the output

Module.name: DataSetSurfaceFilter
Module.long_help: Extract a 2-d boundary surface using neighbor relations to eliminate internal faces.
Module.short_help: Extract 2-d boundary surface.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

Module.name: ExtractVoids
Module.long_help: This filter works with connectivity filter. It removes regions based on region id.
Module.short_help: Remove geometry based on integer id array.

Module.name: Calculator
Module.button_help: Create new arrays using mathematical operations and existing arrays.
Module.long_help: Compute new attribute arrays as function of existing arrays.
Module.short_help: Compute new attribute arrays.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

StringEntry.help: Set the name of the array to hold the results of this computation

CalculatorWidget.help: Enter the equation for the new array.

Module.name: FeatureEdges
Module.long_help: This filter will extract edges along sharp edges of surfaces or boundaries of surfaces.
Module.short_help: Extract edges that meet the feature critera.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

LabeledToggle.label: Boundary edges
LabeledToggle.help: Turn this off if you do not want to extract boundary edges.

LabeledToggle.label: Feature edges
LabeledToggle.help: Turn this off if you do not want to extract feature edges.

LabeledToggle.label: Non-manifold edges
LabeledToggle.help: Turn this off if you do not want to extract non-manifold edges.
Turn this off if you do not want to color the edges by type.

VectorEntry.label: Feature angle
VectorEntry.help: This angle is used to define a feature edge. (i.e., if the surface normal between two adjacent triangles is >= Feature angle, an edge exists)..

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

ArrayMenu.label: Scalars
ArrayMenu.help: Select the input scalars to process.

VectorEntry.help: Pick a value 2 for XY images, 3 for volumes.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

ArrayMenu.label: Scalars
ArrayMenu.help: Select the input scalars to process.

Module.name: GroupParts
Module.long_help: Group parts.
Module.short_help: Group multiple inputs into one collection.

Module.name: LinearExtrusionFilter
Module.long_help: This filter creates a swept surface defined by translating the input along a vector.
Module.short_help: Generate a linear swept surface.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

VectorEntry.label: Scale factor
VectorEntry.help: Set the extrusion scale factor
Set the direction for the extrusion

LabeledToggle.help: Select whether to draw endcaps

LabeledToggle.label: Piece invariant
LabeledToggle.help: Turn this off if you do want to process ghost levels and do not mind seams.

Module.name: LoopSubdivisionFilter
Module.long_help: This filter iteratively divides each triangle into four triangles. New points are placed so the output surface is smooth.
Module.short_help: Create a higher resolution and smoother surface.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

VectorEntry.label: Number of divisions
VectorEntry.help: Each subdivision changes single triangles into four triangles.

Module.name: MaskPoints
Module.long_help: Reduce the number of points. This filter is often used before glyphing. Generating vertices is an option.
Module.short_help: Reduce the number of points.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

VectorEntry.label: On ratio
VectorEntry.help: The ratio of points retained.

VectorEntry.label: Max. points
VectorEntry.help: Limit the number of points.
Start with this point.

LabeledToggle.label: Random
LabeledToggle.help: Select whether to randomly select points, or subsample regularly.

LabeledToggle.label: Generate vertices
LabeledToggle.help: Convienience feature to display points.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

ArrayMenu.label: Scalars
ArrayMenu.help: Select the input scalars to process.

VectorEntry.label: Kernel Size
VectorEntry.help: Determines the smoothing nieghborhood.

Module.name: PolyDataNormals
Module.long_help: This filter will produce surface normals used for smooth shading. Spltting is used to avoid smoothing across feature edges.
Module.short_help: Produce surface point normals.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

VectorEntry.label: Feature angle
VectorEntry.help: Points are duplicated along features over this angle (0->180)

LabeledToggle.help: Turn on/off the splitting of sharp edges.
Turn on/off the enforcement of consistent polygon ordering.

LabeledToggle.label: Cell normals
LabeledToggle.help: Turn on/off the computation of cell normals.

LabeledToggle.label: Flip normals
LabeledToggle.help: Flipping reverves the meaning of front and back.

LabeledToggle.label: Non-manifold
LabeledToggle.help: Turn on/off traversal across non-manifold edges. This will prevent problems where the consistency of polygonal ordering is corrupted due to topological loops.

LabeledToggle.label: Piece invariant
LabeledToggle.help: Turn this off if you do not want to process ghost levels and do not mind seams.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

Module.name: OutlineFilter
Module.long_help: This filter generates a bounding box representation of the input.
Module.short_help: Generates a bounding box.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

Module.name: OutlineCornerFilter
Module.long_help: This filter generates a bounding box representation of the input. It only displays the corners of the bounding box.
Module.short_help: Generates corners of a bounding box.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

VectorEntry.label: Corner factor
VectorEntry.help: The relative size of the corners to the length of the corresponding bounds. (0.001 -> 0.5)

Module.name: PartScalars
Module.long_help: This filter uses colors to show how data is partitioned across parts.
Module.short_help: Generate point scalars from part id.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

Module.name: PieceScalars
Module.long_help: This filter uses colors to show how data is partitioned across processes.
Module.short_help: Generate point scalars from process id.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

LabeledToggle.label: Random
LabeledToggle.help: Select whether to use random colors for the various pieces

Module.name: PointDataToCellData
Module.long_help: Create cell attributes by averaging point attributes.
Module.short_help: Convert point data to cell data.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

LabeledToggle.label: Pass point data
LabeledToggle.help: If on, then the input point data is passed through to the output; otherwise, only generated cell data is placed into the output.

Module.name: QuadricClustering
Module.long_help: This filter is the same filter used to generate level of detail for ParaView. It uses a structure grid of bins and merges all points contained in each bin.
Module.short_help: Simplify polygonal models.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

VectorEntry.label: Spacing
VectorEntry.help: Set the spacing of the bins in each dimension

LabeledToggle.label: Use input points
LabeledToggle.help: Select whether to use points from the input in the output or to calculate optimum representative points for each bin

LabeledToggle.label: Use feature edges
LabeledToggle.help: Select whether to use feature edge quadrics to match up the boundaries between pieces

LabeledToggle.label: Use feature points
LabeledToggle.help: Select whether to use feature point quadrics to align piece boundaries

LabeledToggle.label: Copy cell data
LabeledToggle.help: Should cell data be copied from output to input?

Module.name: BrownianPoints
Module.long_help: This filter creates a new 3 component point data array and sets it as the default vectors. It uses a random number generator to create values.
Module.short_help: Create a new random vector array.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

VectorEntry.label: Min. speed
VectorEntry.help: The minimum size of the random point vectors generated.

VectorEntry.label: Max. speed
VectorEntry.help: The maximum size of the random point vectors generated.

Module.name: ReflectionFilter
Module.long_help: This filter takes the union of the input and its reflection over an axis alligned plane.
Module.short_help: Reflect input over an axis alligned plane.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

SelectionList.help: Select which plane of the bounding box to reflect across

VectorEntry.label: Center
VectorEntry.help: The center of the mirror plane.

Module.name: RibbonFilter
Module.long_help: This filter generates ribon surface from lines. It is useful for displaying streamlines.
Module.short_help: Create ribon surfaces from lines.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

ArrayMenu.label: Vectors
ArrayMenu.help: Select the input normals to process.

VectorEntry.help: The half width of the ribbon (or minimum).
The offset angle of the ribbon from the line normal (0->360).

VectorEntry.label: Default normal
VectorEntry.help: When this option is on, default normals will be calculated if the input contains no normals

LabeledToggle.label: Vary width
LabeledToggle.help: Turn on/off the variation of ribbon width with scalar value.

Module.name: RotationalExtrusionFilter
Module.long_help: This filter generates a swept surface while translates the input along a circular path.
Module.short_help: Generates a swept surface using a rotational path.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

VectorEntry.help: Set the angle of rotation.
The total amount of translation along the z-axis.

VectorEntry.label: Delta radius
VectorEntry.help: The change in radius during sweep process.

Module.name: ShrinkFilter
Module.long_help: This filter shrinks each input cell so they pull away from their neighbors.
Module.short_help: Shrink each input cell.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

VectorEntry.label: Shrink factor
VectorEntry.help: Set the amount to shrink by

Module.name: SmoothPolyDataFilter
Module.long_help: This filter smooths a polygonal surface by iteratively moving points toward their neighbors.
Module.short_help: Smooth a polygonal surface without adding more points.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

VectorEntry.label: Num. iterations
VectorEntry.help: Number of iterations. More iterations produces better smoothing.
Convergence criterion for the iteration process. Smaller numbers result in more smoothing iterations (0->1).

Module.name: Stripper
Module.long_help: This filter uses a greedy algorythm to convert triangles into triangle strips
Module.short_help: Convert triangles into triangle strips.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

VectorEntry.label: Max. length
VectorEntry.help: Stop stripping after this many triangles.

Module.name: Subdivide
Module.button_help: Subdivide the poly data into more polygons
Module.long_help: This filter iteratively divide triangles into four smaller triangles. New points are placed linearly so the output surface matches the input surface.
Module.short_help: Creates a surface with more triangles than the input.

VectorEntry.label: Num. divisions
VectorEntry.help: Set the number of subdivisions

Module.name: DataSetTriangleFilter
Module.long_help: This filter converts 3-d cells to tetrahedrons and polygons to triangles. The output is always of type unstructured grid.
Module.short_help: Convert to tetrahedrons and triangles.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

Module.name: TriangleFilter
Module.long_help: This filter converts polygons and traingle strips to basic triangles.
Module.short_help: Convert polygonal data to triangles.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

Module.name: TransformFilter
Module.long_help: This filter applies transformation to the polygons.
Module.short_help: Transform polygonal data.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

BoxWidget.help: Adjusts the parameters of the box to clip with.

Module.name: TubeFilter
Module.long_help: Convert lines into tubes. Normals are used to avoid cracks between tube segments.
Module.short_help: Convert lines into tubes.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

VectorEntry.label: Num. sides
VectorEntry.help: Set the number of sides for the tube

LabeledToggle.help: Select whether to draw endcaps on the tube

VectorEntry.help: Set the radius of the tube

SelectionList.label: Vary radius
SelectionList.help: Select whether/how to vary the radius of the tube

VectorEntry.label: Radius factor
VectorEntry.help: Set the maximum tube radius in terms of a multiple of the minimum radius

Module.name: WarpScalar
Module.long_help: This filter moves point coordinates along a vector scaled by a point attribute. It can be used to produce carpet plots.
Module.short_help: Warp point scalars into a spatial elevation plot.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

ArrayMenu.label: Scalars
ArrayMenu.help: Select the input scalars to process.

VectorEntry.label: Scale factor
VectorEntry.help: Displacement is vector times scale.
Warp direction.

LabeledToggle.label: Use normal
LabeledToggle.help: Use instance model normals rather than instance normal.

LabeledToggle.label: X-Y plane
LabeledToggle.help: Z value is used to warp the surface, scalars to color surface.

Module.name: WarpVector
Module.button_help: Warp (displace) the geometry with a given vector field.
Module.long_help: This filter displaces point coordinates along a vector attribute. It is useful for showing mechanical deformation.
Module.short_help: Warp (displace) the geometry with a given vector field.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

ArrayMenu.label: Vectors
ArrayMenu.help: Select the input vectors to process.

VectorEntry.label: Scale factor
VectorEntry.help: Displacement is vector times scale.

Module.name: Cut
Module.button_help: Cut with an implicit plane or sphere. Cutting typically reduces the dimensionality of the data.
Module.long_help: This filter cuts a data set with a plane or sphere. Cutting is similar to a contour. It creates surfaces from volumes and lines from surfaces.
Module.short_help: Cut datasets with planes or spheres.

Module.name: Clip
Module.button_help: Clip with an implicit plane, sphere or with scalars.Clipping does not reduce the dimensionality of the data set.
Module.long_help: Clip with an implicit plane, sphere or with scalars. Clipping does not reduce the dimensionality of the data set. This output data type of this filter is always an unstructured grid.
Module.short_help: Clip with an implicit plane, sphere or with scalars.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

ImplicitPlaneWidget.help: Adjusts the parameters of the plane to clip with.

SphereWidget.help: Adjusts the parameters of the sphere to clip with.

BoxWidget.help: Adjusts the parameters of the box to clip with.

VectorEntry.label: Clip value
VectorEntry.help: Choose the scalar value to clip with

LabeledToggle.label: Inside Out
LabeledToggle.help: Switches which part to keep.

Module.name: Threshold
Module.button_help: Extract cells that satisfy a threshold criterion.
Module.long_help: This filter extracts cells that have point scalars in the specified range.
Module.short_help: Extract cells that satisfy a threshold criterion.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

FieldMenu.help: Choose cell or point field to threshold.

MinMax.min_help: Choose the lower value of the threshold
MinMax.max_help: Choose the upper value of the threshold

LabeledToggle.label: All Scalars
LabeledToggle.help: If AllScalars is checked, then a cell is only included if all its points are within the threshold. This is only relevant for point data.

Module.name: Contour
Module.long_help: Generate isolines or isosurfaces using point scalars.
Module.short_help: Generate isolines or isosurfaces.

Module.name: Glyph
Module.button_help: Generate a glyph (symbol) at each point of the dataset. These can be colored, scaled and oriented
Module.long_help: This filters generates an arrow, sphere, or cone at each point of the input data set. The glyphs can be oriented and scale by the input point attributes.
Module.short_help: Generate a glyph symbol at each point of the input data set.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

InputMenu.label: Glyph
InputMenu.help: Select the glyph source.

ArrayMenu.label: Vectors
ArrayMenu.help: Select the input vectors used to orient to glyphs.

ArrayMenu.label: Scalars
ArrayMenu.help: Choose the scalar array used to scale the glyphs.

VectorEntry.label: Scale Factor
VectorEntry.help: Scale the glyphs by this constant

Module.name: Probe
Module.button_help: Sample data values at a point or along a line
Module.long_help: Sample data attributes at a point or along a line. Probed lines will be displayed in a graph of the attributes.
Module.short_help: Sample data values at a point or along a line.

Module.name: StreamTracer
Module.button_help: Generate streamtraces from a collection of seed points.
Module.long_help: Integrate streamlines in a vector field.
Module.short_help: Integrate streamlines in a vector field.

InputMenu.label: Input
InputMenu.help: Set the input to this filter.

ArrayMenu.label: Vectors
ArrayMenu.help: Select the input vectors to use.

VectorEntry.help: Maximum propagation
Initial step length

SelectionList.label: Min. Step Len.
SelectionList.help: Minimum step length used in the integation

VectorEntry.help: Minimum step length used in the integation

SelectionList.label: Max. Step Len.
SelectionList.help: Maximum step length used in the integration

VectorEntry.help: Maximum step length used in the integration

VectorEntry.label: Maximum Error
VectorEntry.help: Maximum error allowed in the integration

VectorEntry.label: Max. Steps
VectorEntry.help: Maximum number of steps.

VectorEntry.label: Term. Speed
VectorEntry.help: Terminal speed. The integration will be stopped if the speed (absolute value) is smaller than this threshold
